snippet: Some ex-convicts in Suffolk County found they had no legal residency options.
abstract: Suffolk County lawmakers vote unanimously to begin process of closing two trailers that have been used for last six years to house convicted sex offenders who have been released from prison and become homeless; say they hoped to move men, about 40 in all, to emergency homeless shelters on eastern Long Island.
lead_paragraph: Some ex-convicts in Suffolk County found they had no legal residency options.

headline.seo: New Suffolk Law Would Move Sex Offenders From Trailers
headline.main: Law Would Close Trailers for Sex Offenders in Suffolk
headline.print_headline: Law Would Shutter Sex Offenders’ Trailers
